revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Website | name = LinuxForums.org | logo = [[Image:Linux forums logo.png]] | screenshot =<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Linux forums.png|250px]] --> | caption = Forum Main Page | url = [http://www.linuxforums.org/ www.linuxforums.org] | commercial = | type = [[Linux]] Support Group | language = [[English Language|English]] | registration = required to post not view | owner = MasMedia | author = Jason Lambert | launch date = 2001 | current status = active | revenue = some adverts | alexa = {{decrease}} 7,163 ({{as of|2011|11|2|alt=November 2011}})<ref name="alexa">{{cite web|url= http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/LinuxForums.org |title= Linuxforums.org Site Info | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |accessdate= 2011-11-02 }}</ref><!--Updated monthly by OKBot.--> }} '''LinuxForums.org''' is a community-driven website owned by MAS Media Inc. for Linux users needing free help and support with their Linux distributions and software, and computer hardware. With more than 200,000 registered members <ref>[http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/ 200,000 Registered Users!]</ref>, it is one of the most active Linux forums and [[free software community]] sites on the Internet.
Support is given in different ways in specific forums, such as on a [[linux distribution|distribution]] level (for major distribution such as [[Red Hat]]/[[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora Core]], [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[Suse]], [[Slackware]], [[Debian]], [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]], [[Arch Linux|Arch]]), but also on an operational level (for areas such as [[Wireless network|Wireless]], [[Computer Programs|Applications]], [[Server (computing)|Server]]s, [[Computer network|Networking]], [[Desktop environment|Desktop]] / [[X Window System|X Window]], [[Programming]] & [[Scripting]]).
In November, 2008 the forum changed ownership and did a complete overhaul of the site.
